channel.title: Help with noclip
channel.description: atm if any1 but me types ::noclip they get auto banned. i have tried changing it but i get like 3-100 erros. can some1 give me a code that makes it where any1 whos rights are 3 can do it? :P

item.title: Help with noclip
item.dc:creator: @Rufio Rufio
item.description:
@Rufio wrote:

ok that didnt work.
i did it and i got 1 error but it was becuz there wasnt a “)” after the 3 and then it was complaining about the “!” in front of playerrights but i took that out
to see if it would still work and any1 with rights 3 could do it
and i have rights 3 and so does my co-owner and we both tried and got banned lol
i unbanned us though
any help?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 23, 2008, 04:42:36 pm[/size][hr][quote=“zacstrex, post:9, topic:232698”]When i add the code to the noclip it ses on compiler error and it has && !playerRights >= 3 { but under the space between the 3 and the { can u help me with this anybody please??[/quote]
u have to put “)” in between there

Read full topic

item.title: Help with noclip
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“justa lol, post:8, topic:232698”]disconnect wont take noclip of them… sometimes they dont really get kicked so they will keep noclip on… auto ban is a great idea

         } else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("noclip")
                && !playerRights >= 3) {
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                    + " tried to noclip and has been autokicked!");
            appendToBanned(playerName);
            disconnected = true;

but i dont think !playerRights work…[/quote]which is why you add a kick timer.

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:10, topic:232698”]‘noclip’ is a client-side command, which is not sent to the server. I don’t know why you all bother trying to remove it; it works by removing the clip on objects, like followed:

[code] if(inputString.equals("::noclip"))
{
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++)
{
for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++)
{
for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;

                            }
                        }

                    }[/code][/quote]he just wanted to remove the rights, not the ability of using it. rights is server side.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with noclip
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

‘noclip’ is a client-side command, which is not sent to the server. I don’t know why you all bother trying to remove it; it works by removing the clip on objects, like followed:

[code] if(inputString.equals("::noclip"))
{
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++)
{
for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++)
{
for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;

                            }

                        }

                    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Help with noclip
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

open your client.java and use ctrl+F to search for “noclip”. It should be your first search result when you press enter. you’ll find a code that looks like this:

} else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("noclip") && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("The Reaper")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " tried to noclip and has been autobanned!"); appendToBanned(playerName); disconnected = true;

delete that if you don’t want it completely. if you want it so that users that have player rights of 3 can have it, change it to this:

} else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("noclip") && !playerRights >= 3 { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " tried to noclip and has been autobanned!"); appendToBanned(playerName); disconnected = true;

Do you see the explamation mark before PlayerName in the first code and before playerRights in the second? that means “if the playername or playerrights does not equal the set amount, it will autoban” or whatever you set the penalty to.

If you want the player to just be kicked, change the code to this:

} else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("noclip") && !playerRights >= 3 { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " tried to noclip and has been autokicked!"); disconnected = true;

The disconnect is still put in place, but the append to ban has been taken out. You’ll notice these once you get more into things. It’ll help a lot more in the future.

remember, an exclamation mark before requirements means isn’t or does not

Read full topic
